meanings.sent1: Bullying and victimising others is never acceptable.
meanings.sent2: The criminal was victimising innocent people in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The playground bully was caught victimising the younger kids.
meanings.sent4: Her actions were victimising the trust of her friends.
meanings.sent5: The villain's plan involved victimising the entire city.

meanings.definition: To treat someone as a victim.
meanings.sent1: The media was victimising the celebrity by spreading false rumors.
meanings.sent2: The support group aims to empower survivors instead of victimising them.
meanings.sent3: The movie portrayed the protagonist as constantly victimising himself.
meanings.sent4: Her constant criticism was victimising his self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's unfair grading was victimising the students' efforts.

meanings.definition: To subject someone to mistreatment or harm.
meanings.sent1: The abusive relationship was victimising her emotionally.
meanings.sent2: The dictator's regime was victimising its citizens for speaking out.
meanings.sent3: The prank went wrong, victimising the unsuspecting friend.
meanings.sent4: The toxic work environment was victimising employees daily.
meanings.sent5: The cyberbully was victimising others online with hurtful comments.
